basics.name: Aman Kansal
basics.summary: Machine learning engineer with expertise in AI, currently building at Parallel as an early engineer. My research in AI has been published in top-tier conferences including NeurIPS and ICASSP. I hold a Master's in Computer Science (AI concentration) from Stanford and a Bachelor's in Computer Science from IIT Bombay.

work.name: Parallel Web Systems Inc.
work.summary: AI agents for deep web research
highlights: Owned image processing capabilities for web search engines, enabling analysis of tables, graphs, and visual content
Senior developer for end-to-end deep research agent stack achieving on-par performance with OpenAI's deep research at 40x lower cost
Led team to agent supremacy on BrowseComp dataset - the most challenging web QA benchmark
Owned and developed specialized domain crawling agents for exhaustive entity extraction (e.g., all Amazon products, Stanford contacts) - one of the core tech behind Parallel's FindAll product
Led development of browser navigation capabilities enabling agents to access form-protected and API-gated data

work.name: Granica
highlights: Lead ML developer behind Granica's data de-identification product enabling enterprises to mask PII data for algorithm training compliance
Achieved 3x inference speedup in deployed BERT models by implementing smart vLLM-like server-side batching of requests

Migrated tabular data de-identification from regex-based column classification to finetuned contextual phrase embeddings from open source LLMs - achieved 95% relative and 40% absolute accuracy improvement with only 25% relative cost increase
Innovated teacher-TA-student training framework for free-text classification using commercial LLMs for silver labeling and T5/BERT distillation - delivered 1.5x recall and 3x precision improvements

work.name: Samsung Electronics
work.summary: Developed diagnostic data analysis software using MySQL, Node.js, and Plotly to track and visualize performance metrics for Samsung's unit test devices. Led research on device aging patterns, analyzing time-induced performance deterioration in Android systems.

awards.title: NTSE Scholar
awards.awarder: National Council of Educational Research and Training

projects.name: AI Agents for Deep Web Research
projects.summary: Building AI agents for deep web research at Parallel Web Systems Inc.

projects.name: Person-Name Classification System
projects.summary: Enhanced person-name classification with ChatGPT and RoBERTa in a teacher-student setup, handling diverse customer data types. Achieved significant improvements in recall and precision.
